en_results_raw: the heat of the moment, when his fingers were slick with sweat and his mind was focused on the spell - he had never thought it was a particularly useful skill to have. But now, as he sat in his small, dingy hotel room, staring at the jagged cut in his finger, he couldn't help but think that it would have been nice to have that particular skill. He had tried to clean it as best he could, but it was still throbbing with a dull, aching pain. He had tried to bind it with a piece of cloth, but it was already starting to seep through. He had even tried to use a bit of magic to try and heal it, but of course, that hadn't worked. He was still four days away from being able to perform even the simplest of spells. He let out a frustrated sigh and slumped back in his chair, staring blankly at the wall as he tried to think of what to do next. He couldn't just sit here and do nothing, but at the same time, he couldn't exactly go out and do anything either. He was stuck, trapped in this limbo of being unable to perform magic. It was a frustrating, helpless feeling, and he didn't like it one bit. He thought back to all the times he had taken his magic for granted, all the times he had used it without even thinking about it. He had never realized just how much he relied on it until now, when it was gone. He let out another sigh and rubbed his temples, trying to ward off the headache that was starting to form. He needed to think of something, anything, to take his mind off of this. He glanced around the room, but there was nothing to see. He was in a small, dingy hotel room, with plain white walls and a single, narrow bed. There was a small table in the corner, with a single chair pulled up to it. That was it. He let out a third sigh and slumped back in his chair, feeling defeated. He didn't know what to do, or how to pass the time. He was stuck, and he didn't like it one bit.

Professor McGonagall, standing to the side, watched with a keen eye, her expression a mixture of curiosity and caution. The air was thick with tension, the only sound the soft hum of the charms dissipating. Hagrid, seeming to sense the unease, took a step forward, his deep voice booming out across the clearing. "Alright, youngsters! I know this is a bit of a shock, but we've got a lot to cover and not a lot of time to waste. Let's get started, shall we?"

Harry had tried to argue, but she had been firm, and he had reluctantly retreated to the Gryffindor common room to wait for news. Now, he was going to sneak out and go back to the hospital wing, no matter what Madam Pomfrey said. He made his way quietly through the castle, trying not to draw attention to himself, and finally reached the hospital wing. He pushed open the door and slipped inside, his eyes scanning the room for Hagrid. And then he saw him, lying in a bed at the far end of the room, his face pale and his eyes closed. Harry's heart leapt with joy and relief as he hurried over to Hagrid's bedside. "Hagrid!" he whispered urgently, shaking his shoulder. Hagrid's eyes flickered open, and he smiled weakly at Harry. "Harry," he whispered back, his voice barely audible. Harry grinned, feeling a wave of happiness wash over him. "You're alive," he said, his voice shaking with emotion. Hagrid nodded, his eyes drifting closed again. "I'm alive, Harry," he whispered. "Thanks to you." Harry's eyes widened in surprise. "What do you mean?" he asked, but Hagrid just shook his head, his eyes still closed. "Later, Harry," he whispered. "I'll tell you later." And with that, he drifted off to sleep, leaving Harry to wonder what he had meant.

El rayo de luz parecía tener una vida propia, y se movía suavemente por la habitación, iluminando cada rincón y cada objeto con una luz suave y cálida. Los presentes se miraban unos a otros, sonriendo y sintiéndose afortunados de estar allí, compartiendo ese momento mágico. El rayo de luz se detuvo finalmente en la figura de una persona que estaba sentada en un rincón de la habitación, y se quedó allí, iluminándola con una luz intensa y cálida. La persona se levantó lentamente, sonriendo, y se dirigió hacia la puerta, como si estuviera llamada por algo o alguien. Los demás la siguieron, sintiéndose atraídos por la luz y la sensación de paz que esta irradiaba. Salieron de la casa y se encontraron en un jardín lleno de flores y árboles, donde la luz del sol brillaba con intensidad. La persona que había sido iluminada por el rayo de luz se detuvo en el centro del jardín, y se giró hacia los demás, sonriendo. En ese momento, todos supieron que algo especial estaba a punto de suceder.

en_first_half: “Oh yes, Harry, I saw it. That woman, or vulture might be a more accurate term, positively pestered me to talk to her, I am
en_second_half: ashamed to say that I became rather rude, called her an interfering trout, which resulted, as you my have seen, in aspersions cast upon my sanity.”
en_results: completely at a loss as to what she wanted. She kept going on and on about the most mundane things, from the weather to the latest gossip about the
en_results_raw: completely at a loss as to what she wanted. She kept going on and on about the most mundane things, from the weather to the latest gossip about the neighbors. I tried to politely extricate myself, but she just wouldn't take the hint. I was starting to feel like I was trapped in some kind of bizarre social experiment. Just when I thought it couldn't get any worse, she started asking me for advice on what color to paint her living room. I mean, what could I possibly say to that? "Oh, yes, definitely go with the beige, it's a classic choice"? I was tempted to tell her to paint it plaid, just to see the look on her face. But of course, I didn't. I just smiled and nodded and tried to edge away slowly, hoping she wouldn't notice. It was a relief when she finally ran out of steam and wandered off to bother someone else. I breathed a sigh of relief and made a mental note to avoid her at all costs in the future.

es_first_half: —Sí, Harry, la leí. Esa mujer (aunque sería más acerta-do decir ese buitre) no dejó de acosarme hasta que accedí a su entrevista. Me avergüenza reconocer que
es_second_half: fui muy grose-ro con ella; le dije que era una arpía y una entrometida, y, como quizá hayas comprobado, eso la animó a poner en en-tredicho mi cordura.
es_results: me sentí un poco intimidado por su insistencia, pero al mismo tiempo me intrigaba saber qué era lo que quería saber de mí. Me imaginaba que sería algo relacionado
es_results_raw: me sentí un poco intimidado por su insistencia, pero al mismo tiempo me intrigaba saber qué era lo que quería saber de mí. Me imaginaba que sería algo relacionado con mi trabajo o quizás con mi vida personal, pero no podía adivinar qué podría ser tan importante como para que ella se tomara tantas molestias en perseguirme. Finalmente, después de varios días de evasivas, decidí ceder y acepté su invitación a la entrevista. Me pidió que nos reuniéramos en un café del centro de la ciudad, un lugar que me resultaba familiar y que me parecía neutro. Al llegar, la encontré sentada en una mesa del fondo, con una carpeta y un bolígrafo en la mano, y una sonrisa amable en el rostro. Me saludó con un apretón de manos y me invitó a sentarme. Empezó a hacerme preguntas sobre mi trabajo, sobre mis intereses y mis objetivos, y yo respondí lo mejor que pude, tratando de ser lo más sincero posible. Pero pronto me di cuenta de que no era solo una entrevista cualquiera, sino que había algo más detrás, algo que ella no me estaba diciendo.

en_results_raw: wardrobe, and a dresser with a large mirror. However, the room was now in disarray, with clothes scattered all over the floor and the bed unmade. Harry's eyes widened as he took in the sight of his godfather's personal belongings, things he had never seen before. There were framed photographs on the dresser, showing Sirius with his parents, and with Harry's mother, Lily. Harry's heart swelled with emotion as he gazed at the happy memories. He noticed a small, leather-bound book lying open on the bedside table, as if Sirius had been reading it just before he left. Harry's curiosity got the better of him, and he walked over to investigate. The book was bound in black leather, adorned with strange symbols that seemed to shimmer in the dim light. As he reached out to touch it, he felt a sudden chill run down his spine. He hesitated for a moment, wondering if he should be doing this, but his desire to know more about his godfather's life won out. He gently turned the page, and a piece of paper slipped out, carrying a message scrawled in familiar handwriting - Sirius's. Harry's heart skipped a beat as he read the words, his mind racing with the implications. The message was addressed to him, and it spoke of a secret that Sirius had kept hidden for years, a secret that could change everything Harry thought he knew about his family, and himself.

es_second_half: alta ventana tapada con largas cortinas de terciopelo y una araña de luces cubierta de polvo, en cuyos soportes todavía quedaban cabos de vela de los que colgaban gotas de cera reseca. Una fina capa de polvo cubría también los cuadros de las paredes y la cabecera de la cama, y una telaraña se extendía desde la lámpara hasta lo alto del gran armario. es_results_raw: mesa de noche con un espejo grande, un armario y una silla. Todo estaba cubierto de polvo y telarañas. La habitación parecía no haber sido utilizada en mucho tiempo. Sirius se acercó a la cama y vio que estaba hecha, pero con una capa de polvo encima. Se preguntó quién podría haber hecho la cama y por qué. De repente, escuchó un ruido detrás de la puerta. Se giró y vio que era un anciano que entraba en la habitación. El anciano tenía una barba larga y blanca, y sus ojos parecían ver más allá de lo que estaba delante de él. Sirius se sintió incómodo y se preguntó quién era aquel hombre. El anciano se acercó a él y le habló en un tono suave. "Hola, joven", dijo. "Me llamo Arin. He estado esperándote". Sirius se sintió confundido. "¿Esperándome?", preguntó. Arin asintió. "Sí, te he estado esperando. Tienes algo que me pertenece". Sirius se sintió incómodo. No sabía qué era lo que Arin quería de él. "¿Qué es lo que quieres de mí?", preguntó. Arin sonrió. "Eso lo sabrás pronto", dijo. Y con eso, Arin se sentó en la silla y se quedó mirando a Sirius con una mirada intensa.

en_results_raw: a storm of emotions raged, as if the very foundations of his being had been shaken to the core. The words on the paper seemed to dance before his eyes, taunting him with their secrets and promises. He felt as though he was standing on the precipice of a great chasm, staring into the unknown, with the weight of his destiny hanging precariously in the balance. The world around him melted away, leaving only the paper, the words, and the turmoil that churned within him. Time itself seemed to have come to a standstill, as though the universe was holding its breath in anticipation of what was to come next. And yet, even as the chaos raged within him, a spark of hope flickered to life, a beacon of light in the darkness that threatened to consume him. For in the words on the paper, Harry saw a glimmer of a future, a future that was both terrifying and exhilarating, a future that was his to claim, if only he dared to take the first step.

Rồi bỗng nhiên, cậu thấy một bóng người ở phía trước. Cậu bước nhanh hơn, như thể muốn bắt kịp với bóng người đó. Nhưng khi cậu đến gần, cậu thấy đó chỉ là một cái bóng, không phải là một người thật sự. Cậu dừng lại, nhìn chằm chằm vào cái bóng, như thể đang cố gắng hiểu được điều gì đó. Rồi cậu quay đầu lại, nhìn về phía sau, và thấy một cái gì đó mà cậu không thể tin được. Đó là một cái cây, một cái cây to lớn, với những nhánh cây vươn dài và những lá cây xanh mướt. Cậu nhìn chằm chằm vào cái cây, như thể đang cố gắng nhớ lại điều gì đó. Rồi cậu bước về phía trước, như thể bị một lực vô hình đẩy đẩy. Cậu đi qua cái cây, qua một thế giới khác, và cuối cùng là về đến nơi xuất phát.

Voldemort no podía entender esta clase de magia, no podía comprender cómo alguien que había sido tan maltratado podía seguir siendo tan bondadoso y leal. Pero Dobby no era solo un elfo doméstico, era un símbolo de resistencia, un recordatorio de que incluso en los momentos más oscuros, siempre hay esperanza. Harry se detuvo un momento, observando el entorno con precaución, antes de proseguir con sigilo hacia el punto de encuentro. He looked around frantically, trying to find some sense of what was happening, but everything seemed to be chaos and destruction. en_first_half: Once they had pitched the tent in the shelter of a small copse of trees and surrounded it with freshly cast defensive enchantments. Harry ventured out under the Invisibility Cloak to find sustenance.

en_results: As he walked through the dense forest, the soft rustling of leaves and snapping of twigs beneath his feet served as a reminder of the ever-present dangers that lurked in the shadows.
en_results_raw: As he walked through the dense forest, the soft rustling of leaves and snapping of twigs beneath his feet served as a reminder of the ever-present dangers that lurked in the shadows. The trees, like sentinels of the forest, stood guard, their branches tangling together in a canopy of secrecy. The air was heavy with the scent of damp earth and decaying leaves, a primordial smell that stirred something deep within him. He moved with a silence that belied his size, his eyes scanning the surroundings with a mixture of caution and curiosity. The Invisibility Cloak, a powerful tool in his arsenal, allowed him to move undetected, a ghostly figure gliding through the underbrush. His stomach growled with hunger, a reminder of the task at hand, and he quickened his pace, his senses on high alert for any sign of sustenance. The trees seemed to close in around him, casting long, ominous shadows on the ground, and he could feel the weight of the forest's gaze upon him. Suddenly, a faint rustling in the underbrush caught his attention, and he froze, his heart pounding in his chest, as a small rabbit darted out from the thicket, its large, round eyes twitching with fear. Harry's stomach growled louder, and he knew he had found his sustenance.

La idea le parecía absurda, pero no podía sacudirla de su cabeza. Mientras caminaba por el lago, notó que las aguas parecían más oscuras que antes, como si reflejaran el estado de ánimo que se apoderaba de él. De repente, escuchó un ruido detrás de él y se dió la vuelta, pero no hubo nadie. El silencio era sepulcral, solo roto por el sonido de las aguas que lamían la orilla de la caverna. Harry siguió adelante, sumido en sus pensamientos, sin saber qué lo esperaba en el fondo del lago.

Me dijo que era una técnica muy útil para un mago, y que me sería de gran ayuda en el futuro. Yo estaba emocionado de aprender algo nuevo, pero no sabía que estaba metiéndome en algo mucho más grande de lo que imaginaba. Después de aquella noche, comencé a notar que pasaban cosas extrañas a mi alrededor. Objetos se movían solos, y escuchaba ruidos extraños en la noche. Empecé a sentir que algo estaba cambiando en mí, algo que no podía controlar. Y entonces, una noche, descubrí que podía hacer algo que nunca había imaginado posible. Podía desaparecer. Me asusté mucho, pero al mismo tiempo, me sentí emocionado de tener un poder así. No sabía qué hacer con él, pero sabía que tenía que aprender a controlarlo. Así que comencé a practicar, a intentar entender qué era lo que estaba pasando dentro de mí. Y fue entonces cuando comencé a darme cuenta de que no estaba solo. Había otros como yo, otros que tenían poderes especiales. Y comencé a buscarlos, a intentar encontrarlos. No sabía qué me esperaba, pero sabía que tenía que intentarlo. Mi vida había cambiado para siempre, y no había vuelta atrás.
